article_title: In Rare Bipartisan Moves, Congress May Remedy Medicare 'Doc Fix' In 2014

article_metadata.description: There are now three bipartisan bills sitting before the U.S. Senate or the U.S. House of Representatives to finally fix a flaw in how Medicare pays physicians by basing more of their reimbursement on performance and quality measures. Doctors, who have watched Congress dither and delay for years, may see the [...]
article_metadata.author: Bruce Japsen
